intro: Tessiera pubescens, commonly known as the hairy tessiera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
